Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Susan E. Wilson Collection on the American Peoples School
Wilson, Susan E.
Wilson, Susan E.
TAM.808
.25 linear feet in 1 half manuscript box
1933-1937 Susan E. Wilson's mother, Vivian Glenn Wilson, lived at the American Peoples School in the 1930s. The school, located at 67 Stevenson Place in the Bronx, was a progressive residential center for young men and women who work during the day and study in the evening. The Susan E. Wilson Collection on the American Peoples School (dated 1933-1937) consists of materials collected by Wilson's parents documenting the culture and politics of the American Peoples School in the Bronx. Materials include a blank membership application, ephemera, dance instructions, and a research paper. The collection also includes theater programs from the 1930s, many from the WPA Federal Theatre Project. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Susan E. Wilson Collection on the American Peoples School (dated 1933-1937) consists of materials collected by Wilson's parents documenting the culture and politics of the American Peoples School in the Bronx. Materials include a blank membership application, ephemera, dance instructions, and a research paper. The collection also includes theater programs from the 1930s, many from the WPA Federal Theatre Project.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Susan E. Wilson in February 2022; the accession number associated with this gift is 2022.020.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Susan E. Wilson Collection on the American Peoples School; TAM 808; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival folders and boxes, and described on the collection-level with a folder-level inventory.
Biographical Note
Susan E. Wilson's mother, Vivian Glenn Wilson, lived at the American Peoples School in the 1930s. The school, located at 67 Stevenson Place in the Bronx, was a progressive residential center for young men and women who work during the day and study in the evening.
